author: Boston__
body:
It’s almost like your expecting mods to do the DD of the stock posted and the person posting it.


Investing in any stock is a gamble.  If you’re blindly investing you’re going to come out down every single time.


The sub is here to allow discussion and post information regarding new and/or potential stocks.  If you think this is a get rich paradise you are surely wrong.


The spam numbers are high here because of the amount of absurd posts.  That being said, just because someone flags a post as spam, it doesn’t mean it is spam.  Additionally penny stocks in general are far more parts of scams than the stocks being discussed in any of the other subs you mentioned.

author: naltrad
body:
Microsoft's official statement on TikTok:
https://blogs.microsoft.com/blog/2020/08/02/microsoft-to-continue-discussions-on-potential-tiktok-purchase-in-the-united-states/

>Following a conversation between Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella and President Donald J. Trump, Microsoft is prepared to continue discussions to explore a purchase of TikTok in the United States.
Microsoft fully appreciates the importance of addressing the President’s concerns. It is committed to acquiring TikTok subject to a complete security review and providing proper economic benefits to the United States, including the United States Treasury.
Microsoft will move quickly to pursue discussions with TikTok’s parent company, ByteDance, in a matter of weeks, and in any event completing these discussions no later than September 15, 2020. During this process, Microsoft looks forward to continuing dialogue with the United States Government, including with the President.

author: BS_Is_Annoying
body:
>Inflation hawks will bug out, but we could barely sustain 2% during a long expansion and are faced with major deflationary pressures right now. 

That really depends on what the federal government does with stimulus. 

IMO part of the reason why Republicans are very hesitant to push out more stimulus for middle and lower class people is that it'll create high demand for products and push up inflation. That hurts their constituency, rich people and business owners, harder than it hits middle and lower class groups. That's simply because rich people are not huge consumers and don't create a lot of demand (Most people only eat 2 meals per day). Poor and middle class people are big consumers as there are A LOT more of them. 

In other words, big stimulus can cause inflation. One which democrats are pushing for and are likely to get into power in 5.5 months.

That and a weak dollar can cause inflation. 

I know there is a bunch of pressure to keep the dollar from inflating. These are just two market forces that can cause inflation to pass the typical 1.5% rate.

author: Not_Flygon
body:
Low float is one of the most important thing about penny stocks. It is what allows runners to actually run when good news is released. Getting rid of all low float tickers is more censorship which everyone seems to whine about.

Secondly, covid had a large effect on the user count. A lot of bored people at home decided to try to learn how to trade pennies, which gave us an influx of users. Then, as people became uninterested, many of them stopped checking the subreddit frequently but they are still subscribed to the subreddit. This would explain the decrease in users online.

Also, when you mention “gambling”, THE WHOLE STOCK MARKET IS A GAMBLE. Whether that be buying Apple or Microsoft or buying a low float penny, it is all gambling and speculation. That is the nature of the stock market. We are all civilized people, and if you’re buying stocks based off of the # of upvotes and the # of posts, THAT IS YOUR PROBLEM. Mods can’t make you buy/not buy stocks. That is your own decision.

If you lost money on a stock, TAKE RESPONSIBILITY. You bought the stock yourself, no one held you at gun point and forced you to buy it. Stop blaming the subreddit and mods for removing spam posts because you “missed out on a stock”. Many of those posts end up being spam, and if the stock didn’t do well, then the users would praise the mods for removing it. WE DONT KNOW WHICH STOCKS WILL GO UP. We remove all posts equally and do our best to keep bias out. If your post was removed, ask a moderator why it was removed and they will tell you how you can make your post a “non-spam” post

author: derprondo
body: Well guys I’m getting back in the game.  I haven’t worked in about 10 years because once I was at Home Depot and a box fell on my head.  Legit had a brain injury and ended up settling the lawsuit for a few million that I’ve been living off of.  I just give myself an allowance from the interest and dividends on the principal, but I’ve saved up $50k or so to gamble on some yolos.  Back to the incident, though, I spent a long time in lawyer offices getting this worked out.  The HD lawyers always seemed so pissed off.  When it was all over and I had signed all the paper work, one of the lawyers followed me outside and he said “hey wait I want tell you something”. He caught up to me, looked me right in the eye and said “buy the fucking dip, maggot”.  I didn’t know what to do so I just limped away.

author: Rule_Of_72T
body:
The industry’s most bearish analyst, Cleaves, just doubled Q3s expected day rate because its 1/3 of the way through Q3 and rates haven’t dropped as much as he predicted.  When everyone is expecting the worst, even a mediocre Q3 guidance will beat expectations.  Both EURN and DHT should let us know what % of Q3 has been booked and at what rates.

Compare the August $5 DHT calls delta to your typical YOLO.  A delta of 1.0 means you own 100% of the upside.  I also like the potential upside of EURNs $10 calls for the run up to exdividend.  I’d be hesitant to have a EURN calls all the way out to November.  The dividend should be paid in September.  No need for extra theta if the stock is going to drop by the amount of the dividend.

STNG is like betting on black in roulette after watching red come up 10 times in a row.  Eventually, it’ll hit and you’ll double your money.  It can’t possible be red again right?  <wipes sweat off forehead> RIGHT?!?

author: UnhandledPromise
body:
Smart people don't work for less money in the end.

The bottom line is most educated Americans have no reason to buckle down and help engineer things for idiots we don't even like.

A direct example is the amount of work doctors put into this COVID solutioning and people spit in their face by not wearing masks, random drug conspiracies.

Another one? Bill Gates, the only guy fighting Malaria and saving poor people from certain death because of an insect 1/1000000th their size...

and people actually believe, without any irony, that he wants to control them and make us into robots.

Why fucking bother. We need a new country. Let all the self-hating morons who foam at the mouth over the new iPhone buy buy buy and the rest of us can just chill somewhere and innovate.

Machiavellianism blah blah blah who cares.

Depressing fact? A lot of the immigrants coming to this country are Trump voters because they hate their own people/race and want to eliminate any possibility of those people getting in, without realizing they are the fucking problem themselves. The amount of Latinx republican voters who think white racists will accept them if they vote for mango man is pathetic and they have no idea they're contradicting everything the country did to attract them here in the first place.

And why wouldn't that be a problem after all? Do they know anything about a fair government in their home country? No. And yet they bring the same horseshit here.

It didn't use to be like this. I don't know when it changed. Importing people with mental problems from around the world isn't exactly good policy though, regardless of any moral argument. These people are also the easiest to manipulate because they're scared, poor, feel lucky to be here, and are driven very rapidly to hate.

Is there a fix to this overgeneralization I'm making? Better schools maybe, but we don't have that. Thus the epidemic of ignorance grows.
